page.title: 15TRANSPORT IN WEST CAMBS.
page.content: The main form of transport is the private car, with most families owning at least one vehicle. The privately-operated 'Stagecoach' caters mainly for the young and elderly, providing a morning bus to Huntingdon for pre-booked passengers, with return journeys at 4.3O and 5.3O p.m., for pupils and workers. Extra buses, allowing time for a few hours in Huntingdon, operate on Thursday and Saturday, market day. On Wednesday the Stagecoach takes passengers to Bedford, Peterborough, Northampton or Kettering, with a different destination each week. By adapting its route to meet the needs of travellers, the Stagecoach provides a valuable service to the elderly, who can even arrange for the driver to collect medicines from the Kimbolton surgery on their behalf.
